MATLAB¶

When running diagnostics on DART output we should use the MATLAB scripts that come with the source code as much as possible. When I met with the Data Assimilation Research Section (DAReS), Jeff Anderson pointed out that my ensemble rank histograms were produced incorrectly and would never flatten out because I did not add random samples from the observation error distribution [1]. These types of subtle problems are already accounted for in the MATLAB scripts.

[1]Anderson, Jeffrey L. “A Method for Producing and Evaluating Probabilistic Forecasts from Ensemble Model Integrations.” Journal of Climate 9, no. 7 (July 1, 1996): 1518–30. https://doi.org/10.1175/1520-0442(1996)009<1518:AMFPAE>2.0.CO;2.
